entries.title: Lula launches stinging attack on Bolsonaro in inaugural address
entries.description: Leftwing leader returns to power for third term in divided South American nation

entries.title: Lawmaker says sale of TikTok to US company could avoid outright ban
entries.description: There are growing calls for clampdown on Chinese-owned video-sharing app as a national security threat

entries.title: Recession will hit a third of the world this year, IMF chief warns
entries.description: Kristalina Georgieva says next couple of months will be ‘tough for China’ due to spread of Covid

entries.title: The Year Ahead: expect the unexpected
entries.description: This year is unlikely to end as experts predict, but here is a map of events to chart 2023

entries.title: A #MeToo reckoning comes to New York courts
entries.description: A new state law opened a one-year window for sex-abuse cases that would have been considered too old to pursue

entries.title: Extinction Rebellion quits disruptive climate protests in UK
entries.description: Environmental group says it will instead organise large public demonstrations

entries.title: Dubai suspends 30% tax on alcohol sales to boost tourism
entries.description: Emirate seeks to consolidate its position as the Gulf’s tourism hotspot

entries.title: Zelenskyy pledges victory in 2023 as Ukraine shoots down Russian missiles
entries.description: Kyiv withstands barrage as president’s upbeat New Year’s address contrasts with message from Russia’s Vladimir Putin

entries.title: Hunt considers taxpayer rescue of British Steel blast furnaces
entries.description: Cabinet members lobby chancellor to offer £300mn to save the group’s Scunthorpe site

entries.title: Corrupt, failing Eskom is a picture of South Africa in miniature
entries.description: Without reliable power, the country cannot generate economic growth and overcome the festering legacies of apartheid

entries.title: UK defence chiefs seek funding increase to confront rising threats
entries.description: Military has to replenish weapons stockpile and procure new equipment

entries.title: Year in a word: Chip choke
entries.description: Major powers have realised the critical importance of semiconductors to the global economy

entries.title: Brewers braced for tough 2023 as drinkers limit beer budgets
entries.description: Consumers are buying fewer beers or choosing less expensive brands as cost-of-living squeeze bites

entries.title: Bad blood between Hungary and Ukraine undermines EU unity on Russia
entries.description: Budapest’s energy dependence on Moscow and mistrust of Kyiv complicate the bloc’s approach to the conflict

entries.title: Banks need financial incentives to tackle climate change, warns chief supervisor
entries.description: FSB’s Dietrich Domanski says without financial incentives like a carbon tax, lenders will resist reforms

entries.title: Lula to be sworn in as Brazil’s new president amid tight security
entries.description: Alleged bomb plot adds to tensions surrounding return to leftwing rule in divided South American nation

entries.title: Meta set to make divisive decision on Trump’s return to Facebook
entries.description: Tech giant’s policy chief Nick Clegg due to rule this month whether to revoke ban on former US president

entries.title: UK ministers poised to launch £700mn fund to rebuild poorer areas
entries.description: Initiative, lobbied for by charities and MPs, expected in new year as part of levelling-up agenda

entries.title: Year in a word: Polycrisis
entries.description: Multiple interlinked global emergencies have been unfolding simultaneously

entries.title: ‘There are no dollars’: foreign currency crunch hits Egypt’s economy
entries.description: Cairo says banks will soon be able to help importers clear backlog of goods at ports worth $9.5bn

entries.title: Xi’s credibility ‘badly wounded’ as China’s Covid death toll mounts
entries.description: Beijing’s war games with Russia and aggression against Taiwan fail to distract from public health crisis
